result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quavon K Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 09/12/2014 FINAL PRETRIAL received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14cf1642 (6 Pages).

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in cases#14CF1240 and 14CF1642.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference, however defense attorney was not able to get to court until 12:15 and case was adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood NOT in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense attorney is not present without explanation.  Case adjourned and remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood via telephone.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Following case# 14CF1240 & 14CF1642 which are adjourned for jury trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Copy of entire court file forwarded to Andrea Dunn, Client Services Specialist/Intern (State Public Defender Office - 819 N 6th St)

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status Counsel scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30am.

Defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's counsel had requested an adjourned date via electronic transmission due to his unavailability for this date.  Electronic transmission sent to both counsel with proposed date of 06-20-2014 at 08:30am.  Response was received from Defense Counsel as to availability of that date.  Status Conference remained on today's Court's Calendar to allow response from Assistant District Attorney.  Status Conference adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Status Conference scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30am.
Defense Counsel appears after case was adjourned and receives adjourned Status Conference date.

Defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
After waiting an appropriate timeframe for arrival of Defense Counsel, Court scheduled next hearing in a timely manner with Counsel for the State.  Status conference scheduled for 05-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for 05-13-2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Moroney.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SUSAN R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
